title: Yi Mains
body: If you main Yi, then you are awful at this game.  Idc what rank or tier you are, what your kda is, what your win/lose ratio is, and I don't give a crap about cowsep, if you main Master Yi then you are horrendous at this game, the end.

replies.body:
Yi is a champion, and some people play him to enjoy him. On top of that, if he has a good kit and is above the average power threshold, I'd argue that Yi mains or dedicated Yi players are also picking a champion that can help their team more than some other picks.

I know I have champions I despise for their ease of use and skill caps, mainly Fizz, but I'm considering playing him myself, because it's easy to turn him into a bastion for your team. I know you just wanted to rant, and I won't hold it against you, but League is two things--a game, first, and a team game second. And people playing what they enjoy who help their team in doing so are the benchmark for all players to strive to, technically speaking.

Most Yi's do not pick for their team though, they almost exclusively believe that no matter what the comp is if they can farm until late game they can right click on everyone and kill them all, and a lot of them time they can, "cause Yi."

I agree on Fizz though, he's kind of a joke atm.

And you're completely wrong. Everyone is entitled to craft opinions from personal experience, data, and observation. People might come to different conclusions. If you're going to say someone is completely wrong and that their opinion on anything related to X is worthless because of one opinion they have (this case being Rengar is easy), how are you going to feel if someone turns that around on you?

You said Yi takes no skill effectively at all, but that's where you're wrong. Every champion can be easy or difficult to pick up, but it takes skill in order to *play the game* at higher tiers of play. Master Yi falls off mid-elo because he is easy to play, but players need a higher level of mastery to play against people who know how to handle him (which is almost everyone post-30, considering how there's a Master Yi every game pre-30... or at least that was my *experience*). He's easy to play, but hard to master like *almost every champion.* Or at least that's my opinion.

How would you feel if I said your opinion was worthless because you didn't consider champion mastery? Every response you give to me, I now have license to ignore and go "lalala you're wrong" if I went by your logic.

Learn how to respect others for sharing different opinions, and realize that you may not always be 100% right. Also:

>If you main Yi, then you are awful at this game.

Logical fallacy, generalization. That is one flaw in your OP, and by your logic that means the rest is meaningless.

Yi can get scary, but only if you feed him. I had this one jungler that just stole all his creeps. He tried to gank after that but it was so pathetic that I just got a double kill instead of getting wrecked. Say what you want about champions that can't get gold or xp, but Yi is feast or famine. If he can't get his kills, he's worthless. He can't contest dragon. He can't gank lanes. Usually, a Yi's first gank is the deciding factor in if he's going to be relevant throughout the game. If he's successful, you might have a problem. If it's a flop then I can almost guarantee that he will have zero impact on the rest of the game.
